subject: Programming
title: What Data Structures Are
description: A fast breakdown of What Data Structures Are for builders.

hook.text: Data is just raw information. A data structure is how you organize it so computers can use it fast.

buildup.text: Choosing the right structure is like choosing the right container â€” a bookshelf, a filing cabinet, a queue.

discovery.text: The same data stored differently can make a program a thousand times faster or slower.

twist.text: There is no single best structure. Every choice involves tradeoffs between speed, memory, and simplicity.

climax.text: Understanding data structures is the difference between code that works and code that scales.

punchline.text: Organization makes the difference between fast and slow.

quiz.question: Why do data structures matter?
options: They determine how fast programs can access data
